intro: Epilobium spitianum, commonly known as the Sierra buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Epilobium spitianum is characterized by its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
